data.enText: a small piece of sth, especially paper, cloth, etc.

data.chText: 她把他的电话号码匆匆写在一张小纸片上。
data.enText: She scribbled his phone number on a scrap of paper.
scraps of information

data.chText: 她是个不起眼的小东西。
data.enText: She was just a scrap of a thing (= small and thin) .
a small amount of sth
It won't make a scrap of difference .

data.chText: 没有丝毫证据支持他的说法。
data.enText: There's not a scrap of evidence to support his claim.
a barren landscape without a scrap of vegetation
food left after a meal
Give the scraps to the dog.
things that are not wanted or cannot be used for their original purpose, but which have some value for the material they are made of
We sold the car for scrap (= so that any good parts can be used again) .
scrap metal
a scrap dealer (= a person who buys and sells scrap )
a short fight or disagreement
He was always getting into scraps at school.
to cancel or get rid of sth that is no longer practical or useful

data.chText: 他们已被迫撤销了建筑新校舍的计划。
data.enText: They had been forced to scrap plans for a new school building.
The oldest of the aircraft were scrapped.
to fight with sb

data.chText: 年龄较大的男孩打了起来。
data.enText: The bigger boys started scrapping.

example: a fight broke out at the hockey game
there was fighting in the streets
the unhappy couple got into a terrible scrap

tr: a small piece of something that is left over after the rest has been used
example: she jotted it on a scrap of paper
there was not a scrap left

tr: a small fragment of something broken off from the whole
example: a bit of rock caught him in the eye

tr: worthless material that is to be disposed of

example: scrap the old airplane and sell the parts
We quarreled over the question as to who discovered America
These two fellows are always scrapping over something

value.def: A scrap of something is a very small piece or amount of it.

example.ex: A crumpled scrap of paper was found in her handbag...
example.tran: 在她的手提包里发现了一张皱巴巴的小纸片。

example.ex: ...a fire fueled by scraps of wood...
They need every scrap of information they can get.
example.tran: 任何能够得到的信息他们都需要。

value.def: Scraps are pieces of unwanted food which are thrown away or given to animals.

example.ex: ...the scraps from the Sunday dinner table.
example.tran: 星期天晚餐的残羹剩饭

value.def: If you scrap something, you get rid of it or cancel it.

example.ex: President Hussein called on all countries in the Middle East to scrap nuclear or chemical weapons...
example.tran: 侯赛因总统号召中东所有国家放弃核武器和化学武器。

example.ex: It had been thought that passport controls would be scrapped.
example.tran: 人们曾认为会放开护照管制。

value.def: Scrap metal or paper is no longer wanted for its original purpose, but may have some other use.

example.ex: There's always tons of scrap paper in Dad's office.
example.tran: 爸爸的办公室里总有大量的废纸。

value.def: Scrap is metal from old or damaged machinery or cars.

example.ex: Thousands of tanks, artillery pieces and armored vehicles will be cut up for scrap.
example.tran: 成千上万的坦克、大炮和装甲车将被切割成废金属。

value.def: You can refer to a fight or a quarrel as a scrap, especially if it is not very serious.

example.ex: Billy Bonds has never been one to avoid a scrap.
example.tran: 比利·邦兹经常与球员发生拳脚冲突。

trans: (废汽车、船只等的)废料场，废品场
